chapter.title: Installing Foresight
chapter.para: This section provide a high level overview of downloading, burning and installing the latest version of Foresight.

sect1.title: Download and burn Foresight Linux
sect1.para: The current release of Foresight Linux is 2.0. To download the latest version of Foresight, visit the downloads page and download the CD image on 2 CDs, or the DVD image.

Foresight 2.0 features a new tar based installer, which is only available on the DVD ISO. Installing the DVD should take less than 10 minutes to install, including formatting your hard drive. It is highly recommended to use the DVD ISO if you can.

sect1.title: Burning an image
sect1.para: Using your favorite CD Burning application, choose Burn Image and burn the image to a blank DVD-R or CD-R.
If you are using Windows, a number of free disc and image burning applications are available to burn your Foresight image:
If you are using a Linux distribution, applications such as Brasero, GNOMEBaker or k3b will burn disc images.

sect1.title: Installing Foresight Linux
sect1.para: Once you have burned an image of Foresight Linux, put it in your CD or DVD drive, and reboot your computer.

Hit enter when given the option to install Foresight Linux in graphical mode. The installer will walk you through formatting your hard drive and creating partitions, setting a root password, creating your user account and password, and timezone. All packages will be automatically installed.
At this point the CD will be ejected from the drive, and you will be prompted to reboot. Take the CD out of your drive, reboot your computer, and you will be running Foresight!
